educational_objective: Diagnose a pneumothorax on a chest CT scan.
question_text: A 56-year-old woman is evaluated with chest CT following a motor vehicle accident.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is right-sided pneumothorax (Option C). A pneumothorax can be seen on this chest CT scan anterior to the right upper lobe and surrounding the trachea (Tr). The presence of air within the pleural space (pneumothorax) is indicated by a dark, hyperlucent area (white arrowheads). Subcutaneous emphysema (air within the soft tissues) is also seen (black arrow).
